alert.note: Alert for Charlton; Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 04 at 2:17PM EST until January 04 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Gilchrist County in northern Florida... West central Nassau County in northeastern Florida... Baker County in northeastern Florida... Union County in northern Florida... Columbia County in northern Florida... Southeastern Suwannee County in northern Florida... South central Ware County in southeastern Georgia... Southeastern Charlton County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 245 PM EST. * At 217 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Taylor to 6 miles west of Ichetucknee Spring, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lake City, Lake Butler, Callahan, Worthington Spring, Ichetucknee Spring, Columbia, Taylor, Macclenny, Fort White and Glen St. Mary. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
